content.data: Opens the Parameter Editor allowing you to add a Parameter to the currently selected Material. See the  Parameters  topic for more information on the Parameter Editor interface.
To query these Parameters via UCS you will need to use  _M:ParameterName  on the Object using the Material. The Parameter will not be visible in the Object Tree.
When editing Parameters for a Connector Material you have an additional tool in the toolbar.

When a Connector master operation creates a slave, the master operation notifies the Connector a slave has been created. The Connector in response then runs a UCS that has been created for it here. This will allow you to create a UCS to adjust the Z Position of operations after all the internal processing has taken place so the Connector Operations can be adjusted to different thickness slave parts.
There is an example within the UCS editor when you click the New tool. See the  User Created Standards  topic for more information on the UCS interface.

Notice you have the ability to create multiple UCS's here. To actually have a specific Connector UCS run you would use a normal UCS within Solid to call it. You would assign the normal UCS to the Master Operation within the Connector and set _MACRO =  n .  n  being the Order number for the UCS in the Connector UCS Editor.
